overview_of_class: Continuation of MENU 321-1. Rigorous analysis on Euclidean and metric spaces. Real number system; metric space topology; sequences, series; continuity; differentiation; integration; sequences and series of functions; inverse and implicit function theorems. Sequence covers more topics, more abstractly, at a faster pace, and in greater depth than 320-1,2 and emphasizes analyzing and creating proofs. Students may not receive credit for both 320-1 and 321-1 or both 320-2 and 321-2. Prerequisite: average grade of A or above in 291, A- or above in 334, A in 300, B or above in 331, or consent of the department.
name: MENU: Real Analysis
subject: MATH
